BarrierControl

class st.zigbee.zcl.clusters.BarrierControl
ID: number

0x0103 the ID of this cluster

NAME: str

“BarrierControl” the name of this cluster

attributes: st.zigbee.zcl.clusters.BarrierControlServerAttributes or st.zigbee.zcl.clusters.BarrierControlClientAttributes
commands: st.zigbee.zcl.clusters.BarrierControlServerCommands or st.zigbee.zcl.clusters.BarrierControlClientCommands
types: st.zigbee.zcl.clusters.BarrierControlTypes
get_attribute_by_id(attr_id)

Find an attribute by id

Parameters

attr_id (number) –

get_server_command_by_id(command_id)

Find a server command by id

Parameters

command_id (number) –

get_client_command_by_id(command_id)

Find a client command by id

Parameters

command_id (number) –

BarrierControl Attributes

class st.zigbee.zcl.clusters.BarrierControl.MovingState
ID: number

0x0001 the ID of this attribute

NAME: str

“MovingState” the name of this attribute

data_type: st.zigbee.data_types.Enum8

the data type of this attribute

STOPPED: number

0

CLOSING: number

1

OPENING: number

2

Construct a st.zigbee.ZigbeeMessageTx to configure this attribute for reporting on a device

Parameters

  • device (st.zigbee.Device) –

  • min_rep_int (number or st.zigbee.data_types.Uint16) – the minimum interval allowed between reports of this attribute

  • max_rep_int (number or st.zigbee.data_types.Uint16) – the maximum interval allowed between reports of this attribute

Returns

containing a ConfigureReporting body

class st.zigbee.zcl.clusters.BarrierControl.SafetyStatus
ID: number

0x0002 the ID of this attribute

NAME: str

“SafetyStatus” the name of this attribute

data_type: st.zigbee.data_types.Bitmap16

the data type of this attribute

REMOTE_LOCKOUT: number

1

TAMPER_DETECTED: number

2

FAILED_COMMUNICATION: number

4

POSITION_FAILURE: number

8

is_remote_lockout_set()
Returns

True if the value of REMOTE_LOCKOUT is non-zero

Return type

boolean

set_remote_lockout()

Set the value of the bit in the REMOTE_LOCKOUT field to 1

unset_remote_lockout()

Set the value of the bits in the REMOTE_LOCKOUT field to 0

is_tamper_detected_set()
Returns

True if the value of TAMPER_DETECTED is non-zero

Return type

boolean

set_tamper_detected()

Set the value of the bit in the TAMPER_DETECTED field to 1

unset_tamper_detected()

Set the value of the bits in the TAMPER_DETECTED field to 0

is_failed_communication_set()
Returns

True if the value of FAILED_COMMUNICATION is non-zero

Return type

boolean

set_failed_communication()

Set the value of the bit in the FAILED_COMMUNICATION field to 1

unset_failed_communication()

Set the value of the bits in the FAILED_COMMUNICATION field to 0

is_position_failure_set()
Returns

True if the value of POSITION_FAILURE is non-zero

Return type

boolean

set_position_failure()

Set the value of the bit in the POSITION_FAILURE field to 1

unset_position_failure()

Set the value of the bits in the POSITION_FAILURE field to 0

augment_type(base_type_obj)

Add additional functionality to the base type object

Parameters

base_type_obj (st.zigbee.data_types.Bitmap16) – the base data type object to add functionality to

Returns

containing a ConfigureReporting body

st.zigbee.ZigbeeMessageTx

configure_reporting(device, min_rep_int, max_rep_int, rep_change)

Construct a st.zigbee.ZigbeeMessageTx to configure this attribute for reporting on a device

Parameters

  • device (st.zigbee.Device) –

  • min_rep_int (number or st.zigbee.data_types.Uint16) – the minimum interval allowed between reports of this attribute

  • max_rep_int (number or st.zigbee.data_types.Uint16) – the maximum interval allowed between reports of this attribute

  • rep_change (st.zigbee.data_types.Uint8) – The amount of change of the attribute to trigger a report

Returns

containing a ConfigureReporting body
